title: Training Camps in Nuevo Leon
name: Training Camps in Nuevo Leon
description: This data presents training camps in Nuevo Leon, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 09/20/2011: On Tuesday morning, in Comunidad de Colombia, Anahuac, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, marines detained 19 individuals at a ranch, which was allegedly used as a training camp for organized crime members.  The marines were on routine patrol in the area, when they noticed armed men near the ranch.  When they went to investigate they arrested the following people: Lorenzo Martinez, Jose Antonio Rodriguez Garcia, Felipe Soto Diaz, Juan Manuel Granado Sosa, Jesus Alonso Tovar, Roberto Saucedo Jimenez, Felipe Montalvo Lugo, Daniel de Jesus Portillo Ramirez, Wilerm Pina Gomez, Juan Antonio Carreon Vazquez, Alejandro Santos Astorga, Jose Alfredo Saucedo Gaytan, as well as three females and four males between the ages of 13 and 17.  It is believed that the minors taken into custody by the marines were kidnapped. The marines also seized the following items: four rifles, 26 magazines for various firearms, 1,376 bullets of various calibers, a bullet proof vest, communication equipment, and several military garments.
properties.event title: Nineteen Individuals Detained in Anahuac, Nuevo Leon
properties.location: The military operation occurred at a ranch near the Carretera Monterrey-Colombia in Comunidad de Colombia, Anahuac, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/02/2011: On Sunday afternoon at 1200, in the foothills of the Sierra Madre near Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, army officials located an organized crime training camp 1.5 kilometers west of the Carretera Nacional, in Comunidad El Barro, Los Cristales. The Army entered the camp through Calle Los Pingos, Fraccionamiento Los Cristales, by way of a paved pathway. Personnel were informed of the location of the camp by a married couple who had successfully escaped from the camp. When the Army arrived at the scene, the alleged kidnappers had already fled.  No arrests were made. At the camp, officials found a family member of the married couple that had also been kidnapped and could not escape with the couple. The remaining family member was identified as 28 year old Gilardo from Monterrey. Officials also seized two AK-47 assault rifles, magazines, 250 AK-47 bullets, two magazine carriers, one black hood, and two pairs of handcuffs. The details of the kidnapping are disclosed in the linked hostage taking incident. No group claimed responsibility but the camp was identified as an organized crime camp.
properties.event title: Army Raids Crime Organization Training Camp near Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico
properties.location: The operation took place in the foothills of the Sierra Madre near Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/07/2011 (Default Date):  On Friday, in Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Federal Police raided a drug-trafficking camp after an armed assault left two Federal Police agents dead.  Police seized seven reported stolen vehicles, one arsenal, more than 100 two-way radios, camouflage clothes with "MARINA" stickers, packages of drugs, metal stars used to flatten tires, and cartridges at the scene. A large amount of clothes and personal belongings were found in the abandoned vehicles. No individuals were captured or identified.
properties.event title: Federal Police Raid Narco-Camp in Nuevo Leon, Mexico
properties.location: The police operation occurred in Camino a San Carlos, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/16/2011: On Sunday afternoon at 1730 on a road leading to the highway to Paras near San Carlos in Vallecillo, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Federal Officers discovered a drug camp. In a subsequent raid of the drug camp, nine hit men were killed and weapons,  ammunition and three vehicles were recovered. The vehicles included one van, one armored Cheyenne and one armored Grand Cherokee.
properties.event title: Drug Camp Discovered by Federal Officers; Items Seized in Vallecillo
properties.location: The operation occurred on a road leading to the highway to Paras, near San Carlos, in Vallecillo, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.

properties.event summary: 10/29/2011: On Saturday noon at 1200, in Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon, Mexico, Mexican army personnel located an active narco camp during an operation after they found a trail near kilometer marker four of the San Juan-Mexiquito highway. Army personnel followed fresh tracks near an orange grove and cornfield, which led them to the camp. All suspects escaped on foot into the mountains. Military seized following: a black Nissan Frontier with black painted plates RG-4606, a gold Ford Expedition without plates with .223 caliber ammunition inside, a Mazda 6 Texas plate CK6-F394 with ammunition, caltrops to damage tires, one bag of marijuana, and a catalogue of informants and operatives inside, a black Chevrolet Silverado with painted plates RD-88487 with a .22 caliber rifle inside, blankets, sleeping bags, and boxes of antibiotics. No casualties were reported. No damages were reported.
properties.event title: Contraband Seized by Army in Narco Camp in Cadereyta, Nuevo Leon
properties.location: The incident occurred at a narco camp near kilometer marker 4 of the San Juan-Mexiquito highway in Cadereuya, Nuevo Leon, Mexico.
